text: It Is for England is a 1916 silent film propaganda war drama written and directed by Laurence Cowen. It is also called The Hidden Hand. It is preserved at the Library of Congress.Catalog of Holdings The American Film Institute Collection and The United Artists Collection at The Library of Congress p.91 c.1978 by The American Film Institute ==Cast== *Helene Gingold - Reverend Christian St. George *Percy Moran - Lt. Stephen English RN *Margaret Shelley - Mary Marshall uncredited *Thomas Canning - John Marshall MP *R. Courtland - Percy Marshall *Lionel d'Aragon - Sir Charles Rosenbaum Bart MP *Gilbert Parker - Himself (*as Sir Gilbert Parker) *Leonard Shepherd - The Kaiser *Roy Travers - The Kaiser's Foreign Secretary ==References== ==External links== *It Is for England at IMDb.com Category:1916 films Category:Propaganda films Category:Films set in England Category:British silent feature films Category:British films Category:British black-and-white films Category:British war drama films Category:1910s war drama films Category:1916 drama films
title: It Is for England
